docs.lead_paragraph: Your Tarrytown correspondent. "F.W. H.," who is always interesting, even when not convincing, indites a somewhat indignant protest against male criticism of trailing skirts. Although the force of her objection is derived almost entirely from the ancient "tu quoque" argument, I am not indisposed to admit the reasonableness of her contention that in matters of fashion men are about as devoid of sense and independence as women.
